title: EEG (Electroencephalography) Practice-Based Professional Training Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Neuroscience and Medical Terminology Comprehension
context.additional_context: Practice-centered education using real clinical cases with real-time data interpretation exercises via digital devices (EEG analysis software)

learning_goals: Learners can identify basic EEG waveform patterns with 80% accuracy
Learners can accurately report three or more key abnormal findings (e.g., seizure waves, slow waves) by analyzing real EEG recordings
Learners can appropriately apply 20 standard medical terms used in EEG interpretation to clinical contexts
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
